fields.description:
When creating issue via direct HTML links, the create button won't lock on, and if constantly clicking the create button, it will produce duplicate issue. 

Example Senario:

* Project ID = 10000
* Issue Type ID = 1
* Summary = testissue
* Reporter = admin
* Assignee = admin

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create the html link, Example :http://localhost:8017/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=10000&issuetype=1&summary=testissue&reporter=admin&assignee=admin [^1.jpg]
2. Try constantly clicking the create button.
3. It will create multiple duplicate issue.[^2.jpg]

fields.description:
I am installing a new copy of jira 5.2.2 on Scientific Linux 64-bit. I downloaded and executed the 'atlassian-jira-5.2.2-x64.bin' installer (as root) and ran through a custom installation. At no point was I asked about user details and the installation completed stating the server was running and accessible at localhost:8080.
As root, when I attempt to stop the server using "/etc/init.d/jira stop" the following occurs:
> executing using dedicated user
> /sbin/runuser: user jira does not exist
id jira
> id: jira: No such user
The installation instructions at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+on+Linux state "If you executed the Linux Installer with 'root' user privileges, the Linux Installer creates a dedicated Linux user account with username 'jira' and no password, which is used to run JIRA."
This did not happen.
fields.summary: User 'jira' not created as advertised.

fields.description:
A SearcherModel is being created and added to the SearcherCollection for each custom field, on every search - even for custom fields hidden by context. This is causing JS execution times long enough in IE8 to bring up a "script running too long" error dialog. (Tested with 1000 custom fields)

A potential fix would be to skip the construction of SearcherModels for hidden custom fields, since they cannot be added to the search anyway. However, the More Criteria sparkler will need to be modified to still allow searching for those custom fields.

Also investigate additional strategies for improving performance when large numbers of custom fields are visible. Some easy wins:

- avoiding the use of _.bindAll in SearcherModel
- check if viewHtml is present before attempting to parse and clean it (viewHtml is not sent from the server if the field does not contain a value, but the code does unnecessary processing attempting to 'clean' this empty value anyway)
fields.summary: High number of custom fields makes issue nav really slow in IE8

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30993].
  {panel}

The IE-mime-type security setting's functionality has evolved over time, but the text has remained the same. We need to update this text to match what this feature actually does.

We should have it have 3 security levels, with descriptions something like:

High: Forces downloading of all attachments. No attachments will be shown inline.
Medium: Allows some attachments inline, such as images.
Low: Enables all forms of content to be shown inline (such as movies and Flash). Atlassian does not recommend using this setting due to the security implications.
fields.summary: Fix IE Mime-type text

*Steps to reproduce*

For example, search this issue (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-5379) in issue navigator: 

There is an underscore in the summary (OS_CURRENTSTEP).

So, try this JQL query : {noformat}project = JRA AND summary ~ OS_ AND priority =
Minor AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY summary ASC, key DESC{noformat}

It "works" : it returns the issue 5379 {quote}(among other issues it should not like "OS X" which has a space but no underscore){quote}

Try second JQL query : {noformat}project = JRA AND summary ~ OS_C AND priority = Minor
AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY summary ASC, key DESC {noformat} (just add a C after the OS_)

It does not work anymore...

So, the bug seems reproductible on Atlassian's JIRA.

fields.description:
I found that if you create a custom field of type radio button and create two contexts for it both with the same options list (i had eMail and Phone as the options), and then set Phone as the default in one of the contexts and not set a default in the other, that when you create an issue that has that field on a screen and then swicth to another issue type using the same field but the other context, that you end up not getting the default option selected properly. But if you do not swicth between the issuetypes and start with the one with the deault set it will behave properly. So its a bug that happens only when you are creating an issue -> select issue type A which does not have the default radio button set, and then switch issuetypes you are trying to create (before creating the issue) and the radio button does not refresh to show the default selection.

I've only seen this in 5.0.5 - have not tried any newer versions of Jira.
fields.summary: Radio Button Custom Field with Two Contexts Does not Maintain Default Option Selection in The UI

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30961].
  {panel}

Referring to the fact that, when adding a time estimation of 1d to an issue with sub-tasks then:

# If you add a sub-task (estimated: 1d) to the sub-task then the parent estimation (including sub-tasks checkbox being checked) will become 2d.
# In that sense, if you log 1d to a sub-task, that will raise the original estimation by 1d for the parent issue (including sub-tasks).

Can we perhaps clarify this in our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+Work+on+an+Issue]?
fields.summary: Enhance JIRA documentation regarding logging time in sub-tasks

fields.description:
When an issue search (advanced or simple) does not return any search results, the 'Views' and cog menus on the issue navigator are hidden.

I can understand why we hide the cog menu, as it contains operations on the issue results (e.g. bulk change, clear sorting, etc) however I don't understand why we hide the View menu. 

Here's the use case that we were following:
1. We created a Confluence page with a JIRA issues macro that returned issues for a particular Fix Version (e.g. JIRA 5.2.3). 
At that point in time, no issues had been assigned to that Fix Version (JIRA 5.2.3), but we knew that there would be.
2. We create a simple search on JAC to find all relevant issues assigned to 5.2.3. We know that it will be empty, but we wanted to get the XML to put in our draft release notes.
3. The Views menu does not display. At this point I actually thought that it was some sort of permissions error.

I would like the Views menu to show whether there are issue results or not.

There may be other scenarios where a user might want to get a view of a search that is currently empty, but they know will have issues in future (e.g. RSS feed).
fields.summary: Issue navigator hides View menu when there are no issue results
Ability to have the option of wrapping long lines in Jira Code Block Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30949].
  {panel}

With reference to the following screenshot:
!workflow_step.JPG!

The order of the transition is pretty much standardized, which means that we cannot change the order of them. The only way to make a certain transition appear on top is to remove all the transitions and them manually again according to the sequence that the user wants. However, it can be quite tedious if the transitions are complex whereby validators, conditions, and post functions has been set for that function.

Imagine having to delete all of them and set them up again. That will be a lot of work. Perhaps we can save time by having the ability to sort it. Just a simple arrow will do like the one that we have in the *Configure Screen* as below:
!configure_screen.JPG!
fields.summary: Ability to sort the order listing of transition in a workflow
Ability to compare values between two "system fields" / "custom fields" in JQL Advanced Searching
Add versioning and/or "undo" for saved filter changes
Allow to change linked issue type without having to delete the link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30945].
  {panel}

Sometimes JIRA issues fall through the cracks. It would be great to be able to send a notification to the assignee to wake them up and do some real, actual work. :-)

CodeCollaborator has this feature implemented pretty well:
http://blog.smartbear.com/software-quality/bid/169853/Getting-Someone-s-Attention-with-Poke

Once you poke someone, an email should be sent to them with the link to the issue.

You should not be able to poke too often. :-) CodeCollaborator allows 1 poke every 30 minutes and shows a popup message if that's violated.
fields.summary: Poke the assignee

fields.description:
If a LDAP user is watching an existing ticket AND has a custom avatar, removing this user will cause the watchlist to hang.

Tested on JIRA: 5.1.6, 5.1.8, 5.2.2

h5. Steps to reproduce:
* Setup JIRA + LDAP, doing a full sync
* Login as a LDAP user and add an avatar to their profile
* Watch an issue
* Delete this user from ldap
* Sync JIRA
* As another user, try to check the watchlist
** Specifically, clicking the  (#) number next to Watch (under Assignee)
* Note that JIRA just tries to load to no avail

Screenshots for more info

h5. Workaround
* Right click the (#) and open in a new tab
OR
* Click on More Actions > Watchers
fields.summary: Deleting an LDAP user causes watchlist to hang
AJS.Dialog button panel buttons on view issue pages lack internal padding due to CSS reset

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30942].
  {panel}

In Create Issue Screen, when we change the Project field to other projects, custom fields like *Select List* and *Text Field* do not refresh themselves to reflect the Default value specified in the Custom Field's contexts.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a Select List type custom field.
# Create two contexts for the custom field, one for Project A and another for Project B.
# In both contexts, create the same list of selectable items, but give them different Default values.
# Associate the custom field to the Create Issue screen.
# Create a new issue. In the Create Issue Screen, change the Projects field to *Project A*. Observe the custom field's default value. (See [^BugReport3.jpg])
# Change the Projects field again, this time to *Project B*. Observe that the custom field value does *not* change to the default value correctly, and appears as "None". (See [^BugReport4.jpg])
(Screenshot for the contexts: [^BugReport5.jpg])

Same thing happens for the Text Field custom field. Except that instead of going to "None", the text field retains the default value of the previous selected project.

Only tested for Select List and Text Field, not tested for other custom fields.
fields.summary: Custom field context default value not updated in Create Issue Screen when changing Projects/Issue Type field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30939].
  {panel}

*Example Scenario:*

While importing data from JIRA standalone to OnDemand, if the user count in OnDemand is smaller than what's in the standalone, an auto generated over the limit username conflict notification e-mail is sent.

The notification is sent to EVERY user in the system for EVERY user over the limit. There is no way to turn off these notifications or set it at least to only go to the system admin. This is highly disruptive to all the users who received hundreds of these.

For system maintenance and import purposes, the following would save time for standard users and reduce email server load.

- Disable system notifications (Admin)
- Customize to only send to a single group (system administrators)
fields.summary: Admin ability to Temporarily Disable System Emails during Maintenance and Bulk Imports

fields.description:
As a user it will great that able to have filters that are longer than 2000 characters in JIRA 5.2.x and we need this capability for some of our filters purpose.

Additionally I'd like the upgrade notes to reflect that this capability is lost upon upgrading from 5.1 to 5.2
fields.summary: Edit or create filters that are longer than 2000 characters no longer exist in JIRA 5.2.
Reports list sort order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30934].
  {panel}

Currently we often link to documentation within tickets.  This causes us to manually search for the article every single time.

Possibly we could have a similar function like @mentions.  Instead though, they would direct to urls or labels in CAC.  

This would save us a lot of time by not having to search for each page.  

Also, if we use this instead of urls, whenever a url changes, or a label would be re-positioned due to version changes, the information would always remain up to date.  This would prevent us from linking to outdated information or broken links.

On the other hand, customers could also use this to quickly send other users to urls/labels from their own Confluence.
fields.summary: @mentions for CAC documentation urls/labels
Ability to view Workflow in text mode in the View Issue screen

fields.description:
As shown in screenshots, the Date Picker incorrectly colors Mondays as red. (Monday is translated to *Pirmdiena* in Latvian language)

Steps to reproduce:
# Install the JIRA Latvian (Latvia) Language Pack
# Activate the Latvian language as default language in JIRA General Configuration
# Create a new issue and click on the "Due Date" field date picker.
# See screenshot [^BugReport1.jpg] and [^BugReport2.jpg]
fields.summary: Date Picker shows incorrect colors on weekend days when default language is set to Latvian
Create a user clone to enable administrator to see what functionality a user has within JIRA.
Ability to make "System Field" / "Custom Field" uneditable / disabled when issue is in a particular status
Ability to clear "Suggested Labels" or disable it

fields.description:
My JIRA 5.2.1 is running behind apache as an https proxy. The JIRA app path is "/jira". 

h3. STR:
# Edit any workflow _using the workflow designer_
# Add a new post-function to a transition of "Update Issue Field"
# Use the field value to have JIRA return an auto-complete of the user name.
# Click on the user search icon.

h3. Expected:
- You can select a user from the list of users.

h3. Actual:
- Try entering a user in the value field. It doesn't auto-complete. (BUG PART 1)
- Click the symbol to open the user picker. It fails to open (see screenshot). (BUG PART 2). 

-> The popup window path is https://jira.eyetv.com/secure/popups/... whereas this JIRA instance is at https://jira.eyetv.com/jira/secure/... 

h3. Workaround:

Use JIRA without a context path or use the text edit functionality.

h3. Notes

This works normally through text edit.
fields.summary: Edit Workflow user picker not working with JIRA on app path other than "/"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30925].
  {panel}

Customer reported issue. When using wiki markup in the description of a JIRA issue, the '#' has a side effect of added an unwanted line between the bolded text and the first numbered item. 

*Parent:*
# Child1
# Child2
# Child3

Perhaps worthy of mentioning, the only way I was able to get around this was by numbering "Parent", removing the bold and using the nested option. 

# Parent:
#* Child1
#* Child2
#* Child3
fields.summary: Wiki Markup - Bold text with a numbered list causes padding
Show more than 100 commits on Subversion tab

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install fresh JIRA 5.2.1 as a Windows Service
# Go to System Info
# Notice the mail.mime.decodeparameters is set to true

h3. Expected results
- JVM argument mail.mime.decodeparameters is set to true

h3. Actual results
- At the top of the System Info page JIRA displays a banner saying the mail.mime.decodeparameters is *not* set to to true.

h3. Workaround
Set the JAVA parameters as per this KB article:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Setting+Java+parameters+for+Windows+Service+is+causing+Startup+problems+or+not+being+recognized
fields.summary: JVM argument mail.mime.decodeparameters is not being picked up on default installation
JIRA OnDemand > Toggle application link visibility for end users
AutoWatch in JIRA 5.0.3 doesn't Automatically Add Assignee as Watcher

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30918].
  {panel}

+Request Summary+
* Ability to define what fields are displayed in issue links section.  Should be able to add as many as possible including customized fields.
* Provide headers in order to allow one click sort ability on selected fields

+Request Background+
I would really like the ability to customize the information displayed within the issue links section.  A current example is that I'm building out a request to use Jira for project tracking.  I've created a 'Project Tracking' issue type for that, and all enhancements/defects across projects will be linked to the issue type.  However, I would want to customize the display so in addition to the summary I could see the Status (not the tiny icon) and also other custom fields, such as 'Schedule' so I can see if the linked issue is behind/on/ahead of schedule, as well as the Fix Version for issues.  I'd also like to one click sort by the links instead of having to go into the back end and manipulate a file.  When having a large number of linked issues, being able to manipulate how we view the data would be hugely advantageous.
fields.summary: Provide ability to customize Issue Links display within an issue

  {panel}

currently expressions in jql permit only evaluations against constants and functions. It is not permited to test sometning like
reporter != assignee
resolved > created - 1d
value >= limit

where all above are fields or custom fields of same type.

Some other expressions could include custom fields of different types like text and select list for example.

fields.description:
The method Issue.getOriginalEstimate returns the "original estimate" of work to be performed on this issue, in milliseconds. One would then expect that MutableIssue.setOriginalEstimate would take a parameter in milliseconds as well. setOriginalEstimate does however seem to take seconds.
This means that doing something like mutableIssue.setOriginalEstimate(issue.getOriginalEstimate()) won't work.

Also, there's no real documentation of MutableIssue to reflect this difference in behavior.
fields.summary: Issue.getOriginalEstimate and MutableIssue.setOriginalEstimate does not behave as expected

Add report for tracking state transitions on issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30900].
  {panel}

My team works on a diverse set of issues and as such it proves difficult to isolate bottlenecks in our development pipeline. One thing that would help this analysis is if Jira had a report or some summary information available that showed the total amount of time each DI spends in a particular state.

For example, suppose you have 5 states in your workflow: TODO, Analysis, In Progress, Testing, and Done. Further, suppose it takes on average 2 days to complete each storypoint (e.g.: as a Kanban velocity metric) and you have a desire to increase your velocity by 50%. It would be nice to measure how long each issue spends in each state as this could provide an indicator of where the most time is spent in the workflow, and hence has the most potential for improvement. For example, if out of the 2 days issues on average spend 75% of their time in the "testing" state, then perhaps you should focus your efforts on improving your testing procedures.

At its simplest level, this information could be provided on a per-issue basis so if there are specific outliers on a sprint or iteration that need attention one could evaluate the metrics for those particular items. Conversely, it would be nice to have more elaborate reporting features that could amalgamate these metrics on a per-sprint / iteration basis as well. (e.g.: total time issues spent in analysis this sprint, etc.)

Perhaps there is some way to write a script to calculate these metrics, or maybe a third party plugin or something, but I have yet to find a workable solution for this problem. Ideally it could be integrated into the standard functionality of Jira but I would be opened to alternative suggestions.
fields.summary: Add reports for time tracking for issue states
